message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of learning an unknown function with a sparse Fourier spectrum in the presence of outlier noise. This involves techniques from compressive sensing, sparse Fourier transform, and complex analysis, which are commonly studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also uses chaining arguments, which are commonly used in the Data Structures (cs.DS) sub-category. The problem of learning low-degree polynomials in the presence of outlier noise has been studied in the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category, and this paper builds on those results. Finally, the paper also considers the problem of adversarial outlier noise, which is a common topic in the Security and Privacy (cs.SI) sub-category.
